It's totally weird but tasty at the same time. If you prefer not to eat them salty/sweet, you can always wash them in your teacups after cooking. delishhhh:D 
Overall it was great. Service is good (considering how much shit they need to bring to you). Food was good. Come hungry to get your money worth!!
author: Tiffany T.

description: We had the all you can eat hotpot.  Lots of food but not sure of the quality.  The broths were good though.   Long wait on the weekends.
author: Bob S.

description:
i literally felt like throwing up after eating here.

In a good way, of course.

All you can eat hot pot, a dream come true, and for a good price too! :)

i came here tonight for the first time with a bunch of friends. My guy friends can eat a lot, so they ordered a lot of meat. I'm sure they got the money's worth, and their stomachs were full. We had some frozen tofu, deep fried tofu, chicken and leek dumplings, spinach, watercress, sausage links, tripe, lamb, etc etc. 

They have different types of broth too :) IT IS SOOOOO GOOD.

The selection is huge and service is pretty top notch. Many all you can eat hot pots don't have that much great selections, but this place has SO MUCH TO CHOOSE FROM.

Word of advice, bring a friend who can eat a lot because it'll be hard to finish the food!

This place is new, so the decor is very nice and it feels really relaxing to sit inside of it. It's perfect for a rainy or cold day.

I'll come here again soon with my friends again. It was SOOOOOOO FUN!!
author: Bonita C.

description:
I love the idea of hot pots....get a few friends, order as much meat as you want, and leave stuffed. I came here once for a friend's birthday and didn't know what to expect. It's probably cause we all drank before coming here and I was pretty buzzed. We had a large group so they connected 3 tables together with 3 pots. Our table got spicy and regular soup bases. We then ordered a bunch of meat, vegetables (to help with constipation), and noodles (fillers). Everything in the spicy soup based tasted like lava because the thats what the soup must've been made out of. It usually takes me a few moments to register if something is spicy or not but when I had this soup base, my tongue was on FIRE. It didn't help that they put little peppers in here that burst with spiciness when you bite into them. Lava aside, the food was actually pretty decent. I suppose it depends if your a good cook but everything seemed fresh which is a plus. The only problem is that if your with a big group they don't keep track of what you ordered! I think our table ordered a bunch of meat and we never got it because the waiter kept giving it to the table next to us. Thats probably the reason why we got balls at our table even though we didn't order them. I don't know what kind of balls they were but they had a chewy texture and exploded in your mouth when you bit into them....I'm not a huge fan of balls that explode in my mouth but these were decent.

I need to come back here again when I'm sober and hungry but I'm pretty sure I would still like this place. It's a good date spot too. You'll get what you ordered since there will only be 2 of you there.....how can they possibly lose track of your food then??
author: Michael Y.

description:
i love great food.  i love it more if there are lots of it.  this great all you can eat place serves wonderful, high quality quality food that you can cook in your hot pot.  there are so many things you can choose from- a wide assortment of meat, noodles, vegetables, seafood, wontons, fish balls, and they all taste soooo good.  

we usually get a half spicy, half regular hot pot to share and fill up our stomachs to the brim.  the staff are really patient with our orders and reorders and triple orders.  we always eat so much food and have such a good, fulfilling time here.  definitely try to make reservations if you have a big group or come early!
author: Irene W.

description: Two blocks away from my place and this place is awesome! i can't believe i've been living near it for almost a year and have just visited last weekend. The food was delicious and portions were generous! the staff is very friendly and accomodating. It was our first time eating hot pot and they were very helpful. I will definitely be back!
author: Kaydee D.

description: Went there Sunday early evening with a group of friends.  Not that many customers at 5PM yet; so, we were seated quickly.  Services were better than what I expected (well, no expectation, no disappointment... )  We ordered, and asked for more later; the waiter and waitress were able to get our food quickly... No complaint.  We sat there for nearly three hours, and no one tried to rush us out, which was exceptional for an All-You-Can-Eat place.  Food was alright, good selection on the menu.   All over, no bad.  It's one of the places that I will return.
author: Q L.

description: Two stars for the concept (we need more hot pots in the sunset) and for the waitstaff, who are really nice.  But I thought the quality of the food wasn't very good, and I honestly felt a little sick afterwards.  Totally unfortunate experience because it would have been nice to find a hot pot place to go regularly on this side of the park.
author: Ernest S.

description: I come here all the time to hotpot. It's all you can eat, so it's $23 from Sunday through Thursday, and $25 on Friday and Saturday. It's a good deal since you get to order many things on the menu, and trust me, there are a LOT of options on the menu. You can order a few items on your first round and ask the waiter for another menu to order some more so you don't have to order everything at once. The food here is really good. You can't go wrong with anything. The food comes out really quick so you don't have to wait so long. I really like the spicy broth, but if you can't handle spicy, then don't get it because it's REALLY spicy. Will definitely recommend this place for people who are looking for a place to hotpot. This place gets really filled on the weekends so get here early. Parking may be a bit difficult on busy days.
author: Vivian L.

description:
Great date night place! The food is very fresh and everything we had was great (mixed veggies, prime rib, dumplings, radish, mushrooms, and all kinds of other stuff).  I agree with others, it can get pretty busy, so come before 7:30 and order a fair amount off the bat, or you may wait awhile if you plan on ordering the items a few at a time.  

NOTE: they do not have beer or wine (even though it says so up top), only soda and bottled juice (?) like aloe and stuff.
author: S S.

description: Been here a few times. Usually do the all you can eat. You can either get spicy broth, beef bone or pork bone. They charge a dollar or so for half and half. I do not really like the spicy broth because its way too oily for my taste. They use the Chinese spicy oil paste to make it spicy and every time you cook the items, they are covered in oil. The service can be bad sometimes as they are under staffed. Parking is sometimes hard to find depending on the hour you come, you might have to park on irving st. and walk. Try the fried taro and also the fish, I find those items very good. You also get sesame balls for dessert.
author: David N.

description: love this place. They have huge selection of meat and vegetable and most importantly, they are all very fresh. Great service, staff are friendly to help. The place is very clean. For those who complain they don't have any dessert: their mini dessert are super yummy--taro dumpling, custard dumpling, and salty egg dumpling.
author: Ella T.

description:
hot pot is great for cold days especially winter in san francisco! 

ALL YOU CAN EAT..!! 

came in with my boyfriend and his friends for dinner and it was extremely packed! people already made reservation ahead (that's actually a smart idea) otherwise the wait could be long. we ordered tons of food and we manage to eat everything. food tasted very fresh and staffs gave good customer service. 

i thought their dessert dumplings were a-m-a-z-i-n-g! taro, yellow custard, and sesame balls etc were delish delish!! 

we left with a happy stomach. nom nom nom!!
author: Valerie N.

description:
Being thousands of mile away from my family, it sure is nice to have something reminding me of home. The Pot specializes in hot pot meals where you cook your own food with others in tantalizing broths of your choice. 

This place just opened, so they're doing a promotion of all you can eat for $21 per person. My boyfriend had to stop me from ordering everything on the menu. I assured him that I could finish everything. He didn't trust me. So we compromised with half the menu. He was right; I couldn't finish the last fried taro bit. 

The broth was very hearty and the spicy broth was well... spicy. Spicy broth boiling. Steaming room. Hmm what a hot combination. Too bad this wasn't Kabuki. But you'll come out feeling like you were in Kabuki.

Very satisfying and fun experience indeed. 

The staff (owner) was very friendly. He seemed kind of new to the restaurant scene since he did some things such as pouring water into my soda cup. Also, the menu line needs to be matched better to the check here line since a couple of my orders got messed up. But it was very easy to overlook all that since everything was really good and the owner did give us free snacks/ soda. I'm sure after a few more weeks, the place will fix some of the kinks. But until then, 4 stars it is. 

You have to come here just to try the shrimp balls filled with cheese. Hmm yummy. And their beef is the most tender beef I've ever had!
author: Wing P.

description: This place is a blast! It was my first experience at a Hot Pot restaurant and I had a great time with the all-you-can-eat, cook-it-yourself experience. It's $24 for all you can eat and I'd say we definitely got our money's worth. I recommend the spicy soup base by far! We also had the clear but it just paled in comparison to the flavor of the spicy soup. The dumplings & the prime rib were my favorite. I also enjoyed the prawns but it was kind of a pain taking off the head and such. But everything was delicious, and I can't wait to bring some out-of-town company here to give them more of an unusual dining experience! I don't think I would recommend it for a date though, since everyone gets pretty sweaty and red from sitting over a pot of boiling spicy soup for that long.
author: Katie S.

description: Food here is pretty good,but a little over-priced compared to other hotpot places.  Service here is really slow.  Also, it would be nice if they had better ventilation in there because it can get really hot.  If you have never tried this place, I would definitely give it a try for the simple fact that it has a good variety of food.  Just don't go in there expecting excellent service.
author: Foodie G.

description: We went on a Tue night @5:30 and asked for the private room for our party of 8. After  we'd been eating for a while, one of the waiters came in to tell us they only accepted cash because the charge machine was broken. Now come on, you should have told us before we sat down so we could see if we had over $200 cash on us. These guys were scamming the IRS, and perhaps even the owner by pocketing the money and not reporting it. They didn't even give us a receipt; only a handwritten bill with an 18% gratuity added. Despite the fact there were only three other parties of two outside in the main dining area, every time we needed something, we had to go outside and flag them down. They didn't even deserve 5%. The IRS and the owner of this place should be informed of the two guys working last night.
author: Jerry W.

description: Terribly overpriced for:  slow service, noise factor, no beer or wine served, mushy noodles, $4 diet coke.  I do not recommend this restaurant.
author: Rosi U.

description: I finally got a chance to come to this place a few weeks ago . My friend and I got the spicy soup base which is pretty good .. it's actually kind of spicy hehe . The beef , fried tofu , etc . were all pretty good . I got one of their drinks .. I don't know what it's called in english but I think it's some kind of herbal tea . It's good to drink during hot pot because hot pot can be unhealthy . And since the herbal tea is good for you , it balances out hehe :) The herbal tea was really good .. it was semi-sweet which was perfect . They have a big screen with chinese music videos as music . I think I also saw a karaoke room .. not quite sure .
author: Eileen L.

description:
Came here for a birthday. The place look nice and the "All you can eat" deal seem reasonable. However...

Food- The shrimp, beef, fish ball were frozen like rocks. Not much selection.

Price- Came out very expensive and not full at all!

Service- What service???? Food came very very slow. We were boil soup most of the time. Where's are beef????? Its all you can eat, if your luck they put in any of your orders.

Events- So it was a friend's b-day dinner, after a not so full dinner, we requested them to bring out the cake (At least we can get full off of that). We were expecting them to at least light a candle and do the b-day thing that all restaurants do. Well....they just brought out the cake in the box and bag that it came in and say" here you go, we put some paper plates and folks in the bag for you. We were like what the heck!!! What an awkward moment for us and the b-day girl. We ended up taking the cake to another location to enjoy. This is a place all 9 of us will not go to again.!!!
author: Katt C.

description: This place is pretty cool. They give you the option of using a half or full soup base (good thing I had that option because the spicy soup base nearly killed me). You get a list to customize what you want in your meal. I went crazy ticking almost the whole list because, well, it's an all-you-can-eat meal. And at $24.99 per person, it serves me right to be so reckless. Everything was so tasty (even the lamb, which I usually stay away from). There was a supposed 2-hour limit, but we stayed longer than that. We stayed so long that the propane for our stove ran out. LOL.
author: Alex Y.

description: love the spicy broth and all the variety of meats, vegis, and dumplings.  loses one star for price, but otherwise a strong choice.
author: Patrick M.

description: I live about 1/2 a block away from this place.  I would have to say that it is one of the better hot pots in the bay area.  I love the beef, pork and the cheese filled shrimp balls.  Def recommend to try at least once.
author: Jeffy C.

description:
I have to mention that this place is an AYCE Chinese Hot pot place...in order to distinguish it from various shabu places. So, if just comparing to specifically Chinese hot pot places, this place was a little better...BUT, I would hope that it would be...given that it is also more expensive (~$25 per person). 

Fresh foods, a huge menu with variety, and different soup bases (tried the Satay and the Pork Bone base - the latter tasting better, in my opinion). The atmosphere is very clean, and the staff very attentive. I loved their stuff fishballs, and their dessert-like balls...filled with custard and taro. One downside was that the dessert-filled mochi like balls was that it needed to be cooked in the salty broth! YUCK! Other than that, if I craved hotpot, I would definitely come back here.
author: Jenny Y.

description: The service was great!!! The owner/manager came around a couple of times to check to see if everything was alright. The food was good. I had to take a star because there wasn't any perserved egg...BOO!!! But other than that, I loved the egg yolk dumpling!!!
author: jennifer l.

description:
all in all the experience was pretty good.

the first thing you notice as you walk in is how ridiculously humid it is inside. probably because they dont use overhead ventilation like most hotpot places. they also dont have their stoves recessed into the tables. theyre just portable gas stoves like the ones my grandma has. 

the stuff we ordered took a little while to arrive. and service in general wasnt that great. with a 2 hour limit here when it's all you can eat... time is of the essence.

the food itself though was delicious. the veggies were pretty fresh, the beef was really good, and the variety of soups (you can get 1/2 1/2 of two different soups if you want) was really great. i think one of the things i loved the most there was the custard(egg yolk) dumplings and the taro dumplings. they were more of a dessert for the end, but man... they were good. i would definitely recommend those. 

the price is a bit steep at around $30/person after tax n tip when most places ive been to were below $25, but the food was great.

the only other thing i wish they could have had....   a grill around the outside of the pot.
author: Brian T.

description: one word! YUM. I guess since the last place closed, (yes, the one that gave me some sort of diarrhea) has now changed owners) This place is super busy, with a whole shadanigean of different varieties of food to eat. I would give it a 4.5 star b/c some of the food that I ordered... does not show up... =( or it take too long to come...
author: Monika T.

description: I have been there about 2 times since it opened, which was about 2 weeks ago.This place have a warm and friendly Decor. The food was excellent, considering it was pretty fresh! The first time I had half spicy soup and the other half regular soup. I thought the regular side was pretty tasty and the spicy soup could use a little more Spice. I had advise one of the owners on this matter and he quickly assured me that he will make changes. I like a restaurant that can accept criticism, and they were definitely willing to. The service was no doubt excellent !  I will definitely be back and would recommend this place to all my friends and Family!!
author: Renee Y.

description: The best hot pot in SF!!!  Food is fresh - choice of different flavors of broth.  Service is good. This place is really good, esp. on cold night.  Highly recommend.
author: Allan B.

description: Freaking awesome place! Service was top-notch and the food is so fresh!  If you have a big party, I'd suggest to book one of the VIP rooms.
author: Karina L.

description:
Yummy with a fair amount of variety.  It's sort of tough to pick all you can eat from a piece of paper though.  We ended up ordering food three times because we knew it would take a while.  Ended up repeating most dishes the 3rd time.  We picked a broth that sounded like a soup and one that was spicy.  Neither stood out so I think the "plain" version might've been better since they charged extra for the speciality broths.  They also charged extra for chicken the night we were there (I thought that was crazy).

We had our infant son with us so I don't remember much else.  There were some things on the menu that I wouldn't order again.  I think one of them was some meatball with cheese or something.  

Definitely worth trying again.  I would recommend getting their early since the wait staff seems to get behind quickly.
author: Angie C.

description: nice and clean place. The food is very fresh and big variety. Place is very spacious for big party too. Nice!
author: V T.

description: Pretty decent food quality for all you can eat.  I mean of course can't be compared to little sheep or even shabu house but you get a variety of food from fish fillet, dumplings, lamb, beef and more to choose from.  Service was great the last time I went.  Let see if the quality will still stay the same!
author: Kelly C.

description: I love how this place you can eat a little bit amount of everything.  Both the clear broth and the spicy broth were good.  The fatty beef were also decent.  I also love the sweet custard dumpling and also their cuttle fish balls as well as the shrimp balls.  I have been here twice and never have problem looking for parking.  The staffs were great and our food arrived quickly.  The only downside is I am a big fan of the long Enoki mushroom which is a must-have for me with hot pot but they do not have it on their menu, but the ones wrapped with beef which looks really really tiny and does not satisify me at all. But other than that, I recommend this place all everyone who likes hot pot and like to eat a little  bit of everything.
author: Kuankii N.

description: $25 for all-you-can-eat hot pot on saturday night.  Add $1 per person if you want 2 kinds of soup.  I highly recommend the satay soup and the SPICY soup.  Perfect for a cold winter night.  Service is a bit slow with orders but you do get 2 hours to eat.  Get the pork tripes and intestines.  Prime rib was too dry even though we tried not to overcook it.  Meatballs were very good... some has cheese fillings.  Dumplings were one of the best items here.
author: Jessica N.

description:
We were at this place yesterday for my bro's b-day.  The food was very fresh and there were a lot of selections.  The broth was great, we had the spicy and the pork bone broth.  I loved their dessert (Crystal bun).
The service was excellent and very friendly.  This place is the best Hot Pot restaurant in Bay Area.  My family was very happy and we'll definitely go there again!!  As far as the price...... very reasonable!!
author: R C.

description:
Went to the Pots on Friday night close to 845pm or 9. The place was packed!! Both rooms and ALL the tables (minus one  that had no chairs) was filled. All the waitresses were running around bringing food items out, refilling drinks, clearing tables .... *repeat, repeat, repeat*... thought it was a little odd that there's no host or hostess or even a cash register person (yes they don't have a cash register in front but i hope you get my drift) to greet you or acknowledge that you even are alive inside. All the waitresses pretty much ignore you since they are so busy serving their seated customers that they cannot greet you at all. Ok, fine. No greeting. So we wait about 15 min or so and a table clears out. Takes them about another 10 minutes to clean and set up the new table. However, they do not seat us. Everyone is so busy serving their customers no one takes us to the table to be seated, so we continue to just stand there... *crickets*..... finally my friend caught a waitress and was like "is that our table" and so the waitress nods and walks us over. 

Anyways, after that whole waiting fiasco we got our paper and started marking with a fury. We realize this isn't a typical restaurant where they come by every so often to check on you, so we start waving our completed paper in the air and one waitress cleaning the table gives us the head nod. We finally figured out how the service works here! After 5-10 min or so they bring out our pot, we chose the hot spicy one, and we begin the feeding frenzy. Had tons of food: beef, pork, chicken, tofu, variety of veggies, dumplings, etc etc... had to remind the waitress to give us ladles, soup spoons and bowls... and then we got into our groove. We ended up eating two plates of the meats and veggies. I didn't like how I kept eating the pepper balls... the broth was an interesting taste that reminded me of a "spa"... The food was plentiful and my other friend drank a lot of the soup. 

All in all we finished everything and left full. Not sure if I'd come back only because the service was a little spotty but the place was definitely packed.
author: Julie F.

description: this is really good hot pot ,its best in bay area i think.i love it.
author: FangChi H.

description: I'm really surprised that no one has posted anything about the extreme doses MSG in their broth. The broth tastes artificial from wayyyyyyy too much MSG. I'm actually upset enough that I'm doing my first ever yelp rating having been a registered member for a few years. Just be warned. I'm certainly never going back here even if it mean I have to drive to Millbrae and stand in line for Little Fat Lamb.
author: Mike H.

description:
My first time coming here with some coworkers.  I never really hot pot outside of home before, and I'm glad that I found this place.  It was a nice surrounding, due to its pastel colored interior and decorations.  One thing that really stood out at this place is the fresh food.  It was delicious!  Not only it was all  you can eat, the soup was quite flavorful as we got the hot & spicy.  Other new items of food included cheese injected shrimp balls & meat balls...Mmmm...making me hungry just thinking about it.

I must admit that $25 a person is quite expensive, but it's worth it if you want quality.  You gotta at least give this place a chance!
author: Brian H.

description:
its like $25 for all you can eat. there's a huge list to choose from. the quality of the food was really good.

but the three stars goes for the service. they were nice people. but we'd ask for a bunch of a certain order and they'd give us like 2 [we were a group of 6, why would we only want 2 dumplings?] and then give us a bunch of something we did care for.
author: Natalie B.

description: Came here today with friends. The place looks nice and the meat are fresh. I stuffed myself for two hours non-stop. I'm most definitely going to come back for some more. $23 all you can eat... not bad at all! Friend staff as well.
author: Edgar G.

description: The food is pretty good here... Just make sure u order a lot ahead of time if they're short on waiters... It's all u can eat which is pretty cool... Wish they had mushrooms on their list... Nice list, not as extensive as little fat sheep... The owner came by and apologized for the slow service but they still managed to do pretty well... Try to get the stove that doesn't use the butane gas and u'll be cooking away!!!
author: Chan T.

description: I visit this place at least once a month. The servers there are nice and friendly and the restaurant atmosphere is warm and comforting. A must go place for a warm dinner in a cold cold San Francisco night
author: Man Kit Chris L.

description:
this review is not about their food

came here for a birthday party. 3 of us wanted to order from the entrée menu and the other 2 people wanted the "all you can eat' deal. Waiter denied our request. Said the entire table must order the same things, otherwise we have to sit at different tables at opposite ends of the restaurant with a minimum of 6 ft apart.
author: cj d.

description:
love the sichun soup base and satay soup base!
everything is fresh and tasty, lots of varieities to choose from.  way better quality than coriya hot pot.  
tips:  make reserservation, come early, come hungry.
leave happy with a full tummy.
author: L L.

description: Probably the best hong kong style hot pot restaurant in west coast USA
author: Nelson C.

description: SO happy to finally see a good restaurant like this near me.  The all-you-can-eat was perfect...but I'm glad to see they have a "$17 for two people" deal for people who don't eat that much.  Got the pork bone soup following the waitress' recommendation - super yummy.  Depending on how adventurous I feel, I might try the spicy soup next time...which was also recommended.  I like that the soup is flavorful but they still give you sauce with cilantro, green onions, garlic, and hot sauce to make as you see fit.  The meat (lamb and beef) was really good (I liked the lamb better than the beef) and they gave you plenty of vegetables.  Like I said...all you can eat!  The service was a little slow, but there were only two people serving the entire place so I think I can give them a little slack.  My recommendation for the future is to increase staff...as I'm sure the cold weather will bring more business.  We've already made reservations to come back in a month for a friends' get-together...but I'm sure I'll be back at least once before then!!
author: Michelle S.

description:
The ambience and quality of food overall was acceptable and well-above average.  However we came on a sunday night where all-u-can-eat was not an option.  They didn't tell us this until after we have already ordered.  Being our first time there, we assumed that it was all you can eat based on a million assumptions.  By the time we realized this was not available for this particular night, it was too late to withdraw all the items we have ordered.  The waiter/owner did try to make things better by offering us an item for free.  Small consolation....

However by the end of the night, our mood was already ruined.  Also due to the fact that we did not receive enough service attention (since we were in the VIP room).  Adding to that, some of the items we ordered were not delivered and we had to reconcile at the end.  They did compromise and crossed them out.  But all in all, it was not a pleasant experience to have to deal with as a customer.  

I would go back for the price with a large group but they do have lots of improving to do.  I hope the next we go back, this will not happen again.
author: Johnny W.

description:
i had been there for a few times, and im loving the place!
$23/25 all you can eat is def. worth it.


Broth: if you are REAL ASIAN, you will LOVE their broth, cause its  super tasty, with NO MSG for sure. you got different types of broth to choose, spicy, pork, tomatoes & potatoes...etc.

Food: MEAT = SUPER FRESH, Beef, Pork, Lamb! SEA FOOD = calms (pay extra), Shrimp, Fish Fillet...etc. Vegetables = SUPER FRESH! All kinds of Dumplings You name it, they have it!
Noodles & Rice = Lots of choices!

Services: the services are very good, staffs are nice & friendly, have quick response on what ever my table asked for, unlike other chinese rest. i been to, this one the staffs actually do walk around and check on customers, specially the young lady with curly hair named Shannel or something? personally think shes very helpful and super duper nice!!  (keep up the good work!)

i don't know what more can i say but this is def. a good place to go for CHINESE hot pot!
author: S F.

description:
Great place, great food.

Went there with a friend who had never had hot pot before.  We were both very pleased with the selection of food that comes with the all you can eat.  Since I don't have much experience with hop pot either, the staff really took time to show us how to cook/eat the food.  Everything was great, the meats were very fresh, the various balls (meat, fish, shrimp, taro) were incredibly good.  The meat ball with the cheese inside was especially good.  You have your choice of different broths.  Because we we're noobs we got a split pot with spicy and regular (not spicy) broth.  I think that's the way to go because some food is better with the spicy broth and some with the non spicy.

The place was very clean and the decor modern.  The staff was incredibly helpful and friendly and came by many times to make sure we were OK.  The price for the all you can eat is pretty good.  Seems like it would hard to get the variety of dishes and the amount for less than the all you can eat price.
author: Jon F.

description: came here with my parents the other night and the food was good... well it takes alot to F up a hot pot lolz, all you can eat and the service was good...i will come back there were a few things i couldn't try because i  was stuffed hahaha
author: jonathan h.

description: If I could give this place 0 stars I would gladly do so. I've been to The Pots a few times before and things were ok each time....not anymore though.  I booked a reservation for 12 people about 1 week ahead for my fiancee's birthday dinner.  Everything went smoothly and I even confirmed the day of to make sure my reservation was still good before I confirm with all my friends who where coming from San Jose and Berkeley. I called The Pots and this lady told me that everything was fine and that our reservation was still good and " see you tonight."  So I thought everything was fine as she stated, then about 30 minutes before our reservation time the same lady calls me as I'm driving to them and tells me that they can't honor my reservation unless I pay more because they have someone else that wants our reservation time. So basically, they wanted to push me out of my reservation even though I had made my reservation a week ahead, its 30 minutes before all my friends from San Jose and Berkeley arrive, and if I won't budge then I have to pay for 15 people's all u can eat even though I only have 12....SHAMEFUL! Its disgusting to try to squeeze more money outta me ($100) and force me to cancel my reservation even though both them and I have confirmed it just 30mins ago. I then asked to speak to the person in charge, and the lady said that she was. So basically it was give them $100 more for no reason or find another place to eat at the last minute and tell my friends coming from afar. Seriously, the worst business tactics ever! I can honestly say that this place has the WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE EVER! I will never ever go back again !
author: Stephanie W.

description: We decided to try this restaurant because the one we wanted to go to closed. This restaurant is hot pot only and no grill. You can choose to order by plate or all you can eat for about 20-25 + tax depending what day of the week you go on. Keep in mind if you choose all you can eat, there is a 2 hour limit. We started our meal quite slowly since our soup refused to boil, but after 20 mins we discovered we were actually out of gas. I suggest when eating here when ordering, to order a bit more than you think you need because the portions are related to the number of guests. So if you are a party of 8...you will get 8 shrimps. In addition, keep track of your meat orders. We got all our vegetables, dumplings and meat balls but the meat never came. We had to reorder with the waiter. The best part of the meal though was the dessert custard and taro balls. I did find it strange that you just toss them into the salty broth, but it gave it only a slight saltiness that balanced the sweetness from the filling (an method often used with cakes, cookies and candy). Although I think this place is quite pricey, but the dessert balls are a good enough reason for me to come back.
author: Jess H.

description: This place is awesome.  It's all you can eat and it's worth the $$.   The place is cozy and the meat you cook is fresh. Got to try the dumplings.
author: Dan G.

description: Yum. We ordered a pot of the sichuan spice soup base, enoki mushrooms, fried tofu, tofu skins, bok choy, a couple of other things, and udon noodles. The soup was delicious, the service was fast, the atmosphere was fun and the veggies/tofu was fresh. The taste of a lot of the items reminded me a lot of what huoguo was like in Shanghai. I'd recommend this to anybody looking for a solid cold weather meal. The only knock is we didn't order a ton and it came up to $20 a person after tip. Seemed a bit pricey, but well worth it.
author: Aditya B.

description: food was pretty darn good, the fatty beef was excellent and the taro buns were mmmmmmmmm sooooo gooooood. Service was top notch, although on the busy nights (weekends) the service may be a little slow and the line is an hour long, its worth it!
author: Jason L.

description:
heard about this place from friends, and with the demise of Coriya on clement and 10th needed another place to get hot pot.
no comparison.  even though you're supposed to be able to eat all you want, you have to check off items on a sheet of paper, give it to the server and they bring it back to you.  this takes time (you can't control how long it takes to get the food you've checked).  it was busy when we came for dinner so things didn't move that quickly.  and they didn't get all the order correct, missing some items and giving us other items we hadn't checked.  
the soup for the hotpot had seasoning, something we didn't expect, asking for clear broth..  it was not a clear broth but kinda milky like you would get from having done a beef or chicken broth (the protein can make the broth milky in color).  Also, they must have put lots of salt and/or MSG in it because as it cooked down it became extremely salty and heavy... leaving your mouth with a dehydrated feeling..  and wanting lots of water.
I'm sorry this was the case.  the food itself was fine, not old.. but for $22.99 a person, this is on the steep end for me.
author: dee c.

description: all you can eat at a cheap price! although the place doesnt look really appealing to me. but there are a wide range of choice for food and broth. although sometimes they might run out of it. the waiters are always busy. but i would recommend this place.
author: pineapple b.

description: This place was amazing! Great food, friendly service, and very clean.  I often complain about the absence of good hot pot restaurants in San Francisco.  The Pot's solves my problem!  I am already planning a return visit.
author: Michele L.

description: it's hard to quit eating here. they're all you can eat and when it's good food it's just hard to stop. the beef is top notch quality and IT'S ALL YOU CAN EAT! their sauce is great too. fresh grated garlic and chopped green onions are just a few of the toppings you can add. it's worth the price.
author: Bobby K.

description: I had a great time here with a bunch of friends.  I like the fact that it's all you can eat and trust me, we ordered a LOT.  They didn't give us attitudes for it, which is a plus.  Their meat is not as good as Shabu House's but they have a lot more variety.  It can be pricey on a weekend if you come with more than 6 people (18% gratuities), have the spicy soup, and some beers.  Each of us paid approximately $36.  Acckk.
author: Gina R.

description: Not too good and Not too bad....i know i can't compare the hot pot in HKs....but 20+sth with 18%tips...i think a little bit too much....the food is great..beside the beef....everything is ok.....service is fine..even they forgot or miss some of the order......but not charged 18% .....we had group of 14 ....end up the 18% 65$ .........:(.....
author: Ben P.

description: the food was quick and delicious. their service were excellent, especially from the gentlemen. keep up the good work.
author: Braden L.

description: went there on sunday with 2 other friends.  the place itself is not fancy...typical chinese style restaurant.  as i was walking in, i could smell instantly what seemed like pho smell.  we ordered split soup base, spicy and regular.  the smell was very good at first but as time passes, the smell of the soup base was overpowering.  we ordered bunch of things. the best things on the menu was the prime beef and the lamb.  they were very good.  don't waste ur time with the meat balls (any kind of meat balls), it's not very good.  we ordered shrimp but we didn't eat it b/c we didn't want to peel them.  the tofu skin roll was actually very good.  the veggies are fresh but nothing special.  the egg custard and taro buns were good but thought of dipping the sweet desert buns in a spicy broth or regular broth weren't very appetizing.  the best part of the meal was the beef.  but after an hour of sitting there with the broth steaming up and the smell got to us and we had to stop eating.  after awhile, everything start to taste the same.  overall, it was my first experience in hot pot (had shabu shabu many times) and it was good and enjoyed the experience but i don't think i will be back anytime soon.  oh, the waiter/waitress are super nice...they were all super attentive and that made it even better experience so i am giving them 4 stars.
author: donald c.
